components.description:
A jewel or gem, as set into a ring. Depicted in the shape of a classic diamond but in the bright blue color of an aquamarine.

Commonly used for various content concerning jewelry, as upon an engagement or marriage. May also convey various literal and figurative senses of beauty, wealth, sophistication, preciousness, and sparkling.

Note: this emoji is not supported in Twitter / X names, to minimize confusion with a verified checkmark. Learn more here.
components.title: Gem Stone

description:
A jewel or gem, as set into a ring. Depicted in the shape of a classic diamond but in the bright blue color of an aquamarine.

Commonly used for various content concerning jewelry, as upon an engagement or marriage. May also convey various literal and figurative senses of beauty, wealth, sophistication, preciousness, and sparkling.

title: Gem Stone

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Romance symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A gemÂ that appears blue on screen, but is presumably intended to appearÂ of similar shade to a diamond. Gem Stone was approved as part of Uni http://emojipedia.org/gem-stone/
emoji_net_data.name: gem stone

bn:00103623a: As if shining with a brilliant light; radiant.

bn:00113489a: Having great material or monetary value especially for use or exchange

bn:13773520a: Made of, or containing diamond, a diamond or diamonds.

bn:13721484v: To adorn with or as if with diamonds

bn:13788122v: To adorn with, or as if with, gems.

bn:00083358v: Adorn or decorate with precious stones

bn:00084331v: Obtain by purchase; acquire by means of a financial transaction
To obtain (something) in exchange for money or goods
To buy, obtain by payment of a price in money or its equivalent.
To obtain in exchange for money or goods.

bn:00048188n: Jewellery or jewelry is small decorative items worn for personal adornment, such as brooches, rings, necklaces, earrings, and bracelets.
An adornment (as a bracelet or ring or necklace) made of precious metals and set with gems (or imitation gems)
Collectively, personal ornamentation such as rings, necklaces, brooches and bracelets, made of precious metals and sometimes set with gemstones.

bn:00037609n: Pieces of jewellery or ornaments that contain precious stones.
A precious or semi-precious stone; gem, gemstone.
A precious or semiprecious stone incorporated into a piece of jewelry

bn:00037606n: An attractive mineral used for adornments
Piece of mineral used to make jewelry
A crystalline rock that can be cut and polished for jewelry
Any gem, such as a diamond or ruby, that is expensive because of its rarity or desirability; especially one set into a piece of jewelry.
A small piece of stone, a pebble.
A gemstone or gem is a piece of crystal, which, in cut and polished form, is used to make jewelry or other adornments.
A valuable stone that has been cut and polished and is used in jewellery.
